Ding Ding Magic

A children's musical booklet

Scene 1

Section 1 (pages 1-2)

等等！
dang2 dang2!
Wait!

吓？等等邊個？
haa2? dang2 dang2 bin1 go3?
Huh? Wait for who?

係我呀，你頭先話吖話？
hai6 ngo5 aa3, nei5 tau4 sin1 waa6 aa1 waa2?
Me! What were you saying just now?

頭先？啊，我要施展魔法。
tau4 sin1? aa3, ngo5 jiu3 si1 zin2 mo4 faat3.
Just now? Ah, I was about to cast magic.

唔係呢句呀，再之前。
m4 hai6 ni1 geoi3 aa3, zoi3 zi1 cin4.
Not that line—before that.

再之前我攞起一支魔法棒，唸一句咒語，指住自己想變嘅物件。
zoi3 zi1 cin4 ngo5 lo2 hei2 jat1 zi1 mo4 faat3 paang5, nim6 jat1 geoi3 zau3 jyu5, zi2 zyu6 zi6 gei2 seung2 bin3 ge3 mat6 gin6.
Before that, I pick up a magic wand, chant a spell, and point it at whatever I want to transform.

都唔係呢句，係再之前。
dou1 m4 hai6 ni1 geoi3, hai6 zoi3 zi1 cin4.
Still not that line. Even earlier.

再之前……我想同大家講一個充滿魔法嘅故事。
zoi3 zi1 cin4… ngo5 seung2 tung4 daai6 gaa1 gong2 jat1 go3 cung1 mun5 mo4 faat3 ge3 gu3 si6.
Earlier than that… I wanted to tell everyone a story full of magic.

（不耐煩）都唔係呀。
(bat1 noi6 faan4) dou1 m4 hai6 aa3.
(Impatient) Not that either.

再之前係一句呀？
zoi3 zi1 cin4 hai6 jat1 geoi3 aa3?
Which line before that?

你話我哋係一班普通嘅學生。
nei5 waa6 ngo5 dei6 hai6 jat1 baan1 pou2 tung1 ge3 hok6 saang1.
You said we’re just an ordinary bunch of students.

（疑惑）係吖，點呢？
(ji4 waak6) hai6 aa3, dim2 ne1?
(Confused) Yes… so?

你就大錯特錯啦。
nei5 zau6 daai6 co3 dak6 co3 laa1.
Then you are completely wrong.

（疑惑）我？錯喺邊呀？
(ji4 waak6) ngo5? co3 hai2 bin1 aa3?
(Confused) Me? Wrong about what?

我梗唔係一班普通嘅學生啦。
ngo5 gang2 m4 hai6 jat1 baan1 pou2 tung1 ge3 hok6 saang1 laa1.
I’m definitely not just an ordinary student.

唔通你哋就係一班識魔法嘅學生？
m4 tung1 nei5 dei6 zau6 hai6 jat1 baan1 sik1 mo4 faat3 ge3 hok6 saang1?
Don’t tell me you’re students who actually know magic?

無錯！唔好睇小我吖，我就叫做遙遙，雖然我生得細細粒，但係我真係識得魔法㗎。
mou4 co3! m4 hou2 tai2 siu2 ngo5 aa3, ngo5 zau6 giu3 zou6 jiu4 jiu4, seoi1 jin4 ngo5 saang1 dak1 sai3 sai3 nap1, daan6 hai6 ngo5 zan1 hai6 sik1 dak1 mo4 faat3 gaa3.
That’s right! Don’t underestimate me. I’m Yiu-Yiu. I may be tiny, but I really do know magic.

你真係識魔法？
nei5 zan1 hai6 sik1 mo4 faat3?
You really know magic?

唔止遙遙，我哋個個都識得魔法㗎！
m4 zi2 jiu4 jiu4, ngo5 dei6 go3 go3 dou1 sik1 dak1 mo4 faat3 gaa3!
Not just Yiu-Yiu—every one of us can use magic!

Oh yeah, baby!
Oh yeah, baby!
Oh yeah, baby!

你哋係？
nei5 dei6 hai6?
And you are…?

我係遙遙。
ngo5 hai6 jiu4 jiu4.
I’m Yiu-Yiu.

我係安娜。
ngo5 hai6 on1 no4.
I’m Anna.

Hi，我係花輪達爾。
Hi, ngo5 hai6 faa1 leon4 daat6 ji5.
Hi, I’m Dar.

我哋就係愛叮堡學院嘅學生。
ngo5 dei6 zau6 hai6 oi3 ding1 bou2 hok6 jyun2 ge3 hok6 saang1.
We’re students of Love-Ding Fort Academy.

等陣先，唔好擺甫士住，你真係識魔法？
dang2 zan6 sin1, m4 hou2 baai2 pou2 si6 zyu6, nei5 zan1 hai6 sik1 mo4 faat3?
Hold on—stop striking poses for a second. You really know magic?

唔止我，我哋愛叮堡學院每一個學生，都識得魔法㗎。
m4 zi2 ngo5, ngo5 dei6 oi3 ding1 bou2 hok6 jyun2 mui5 jat1 go3 hok6 saang1, dou1 sik1 dak1 mo4 faat3 gaa3.
Not just me—every student at Love-Ding Fort Academy can use magic.

Baby，我嘅魔法，唔使唸咒語，仲唔需要用呢枝魔法棒。
Baby, ngo5 ge3 mo4 faat3, m4 sai2 nim6 zau3 jyu5, zung6 m4 seoi1 jiu3 jung6 ni1 zi1 mo4 faat3 paang5.
Baby, my magic doesn’t need spells, and I don’t even need this magic wand.

我哋呢一種魔法，叫做「叮叮魔法」。
ngo5 dei6 ni1 jat1 zung2 mo4 faat3, giu3 zou6 “ding1 ding1 mo4 faat3”.
This kind of magic of ours is called “Ding Ding Magic.”

只要伸一伸手！
zi2 jiu3 san1 jat1 san1 sau2!
Just stretch out your hand!

只要開口！
zi2 jiu3 hoi1 hau2!
Just open your mouth!

只要叮一聲。
zi2 jiu3 ding1 jat1 seng1.
Just give one “ding.”

神奇？
san4 kei4?
Amazing?

唔信呀？等我哋表演畀大家睇。
m4 seon3 aa3? dang2 ngo5 dei6 biu2 jin2 bei2 daai6 gaa1 tai2.
Don’t believe us? We’ll show you.

大家準備好未呀？一齊舉起手嗌「叮」！
daai6 gaa1 zeon2 bei6 hou2 mei6 aa3? jat1 cai4 geoi2 hei2 sau2 aai3 “ding1”!
Is everyone ready? Raise your hands and shout “Ding” together!

1, 2, 3，叮！
1, 2, 3, ding1!
1, 2, 3—Ding!

Section 2 (pages 3-4)

緩緩漫步
waan2 waan2 maan6 bou6
Strolling along slowly.

坐在這高貴椅上
co5 zoi6 ze5 gou1 gwai3 ji2 soeng6
Seated on this noble chair.

默念我想要景象
mak6 nim6 ngo5 seung2 jiu3 ging2 zoeng6
Silently picturing the scene I want.

我只要，叮一聲
ngo5 zi2 jiu3, ding1 jat1 seng1
I just need one ding.

香蕉 Pancake，刀叉放兩行，煎得最香
hoeng1 ziu1 Pancake, dou1 caa1 fong3 loeng5 hong4, zin1 dak1 zeoi3 hoeng1
Banana pancake, fork and knife in place, cooked to the best aroma.

叮一聲，心開朗，能量滿
ding1 jat1 seng1, sam1 hoi1 long5, nang4 loeng6 mun5
One ding—heart bright, energy full.

橙汁送眼前
caang2 zap1 sung3 ngaan5 cin4
Orange juice appears before our eyes.

你可好奇，精彩把戲，究竟可以使你歡喜
nei5 ho2 hou2 kei4, zing1 coi2 baa2 hei3, gau3 ging2 ho2 ji5 si2 nei5 fun1 hei2
Are you curious what wonderful tricks can make you smile?

各種困難，超高速解決
gok3 zung2 kwan3 naan4, ciu1 gou1 cuk1 gaai2 kyut3
Every kind of trouble solved at super speed.

天天都充滿愉快驚喜
tin1 tin1 dou1 cung1 mun5 jyu4 faai3 ging1 hei2
Every day is full of happy surprises.

噹噹鐘聲，即刻到校園
dong1 dong1 zung1 seng1, zik1 hak1 dou3 haau6 jyun4
Ding-dong bells, and we’re at school right away.

朝著那新一天、新一個旅程，奇妙的前路向
ciu4 zoek6 naa5 san1 jat1 tin1, san1 jat1 go3 leoi5 cing4, kei4 miu6 dik1 cin4 lou6 hoeng3
Toward a new day, a new journey, and a wondrous road ahead.

弊啦！唔記得帶樂器。
bai6 laa1! m4 gei3 dak1 daai3 ngok6 hei3.
Oh no! I forgot my instrument.

我唔記得帶書啊。
ngo5 m4 gei3 dak1 daai3 syu1 aa3.
I forgot to bring my books.

咦？我個箏袋呢？
ji2? ngo5 go3 zang1 doi2 ne1?
Huh? Where’s my zither bag?

唔使心急。
m4 sai2 sam1 gap1.
No need to panic.

箏袋書本，叮一聲，書包送來。
zang1 doi2 syu1 bun2, ding1 jat1 seng1, syu1 baau1 sung3 loi4.
Zither bag and books—one ding, and the schoolbag arrives.

即刻打開，覓理想；文字裡吸收知識，專心咪發呆。
zik1 hak1 daa2 hoi1, mik6 lei5 seung2; man4 zi6 leoi5 kap1 sau1 zi1 sik1, zyun1 sam1 mai5 faat3 ngoi4.
Open it right away, chase your dreams; absorb knowledge from words, stay focused, don’t drift.

叮一聲，開心高歌，解決各種的困難，奇妙滿人間。
ding1 jat1 seng1, hoi1 sam1 gou1 go1, gaai2 kyut3 gok3 zung2 dik1 kwan3 naan4, kei4 miu6 mun5 jan4 gaan1.
One ding, sing with joy, solve all kinds of troubles, and fill the world with wonder.

嘩！遙遙，你叮叮魔法又進步啦。
waa3! jiu4 jiu4, nei5 ding1 ding1 mo4 faat3 jau6 zeon3 bou6 laa1.
Wow, Yiu-Yiu, your Ding Ding Magic has improved again.

（擘頭髮）Baby! It’s amazing to have magic power.
(maak3 tau4 faat3) Baby! It’s amazing to have magic power.
(Flipping hair) Baby! It’s amazing to have magic power.

快啲返到嚟學校啦！
faai3 di1 faan1 dou3 lai4 hok6 haau6 laa1!
We got back to school so fast!

只要有咗叮叮魔法，生活就簡單好多啦。
zi2 jiu3 jau5 zo2 ding1 ding1 mo4 faat3, saang1 wut6 zau6 gaan2 daan1 hou2 do1 laa1.
With Ding Ding Magic, life gets so much easier.

Yes, baby! 好口渴呀，只要……
Yes, baby! hou2 hau2 hot3 aa3, zi2 jiu3…
Yes, baby! I’m so thirsty—just need…

Refreshing!
Refreshing!
Refreshing!

今日我有帶數學和中文書。
gam1 jat6 ngo5 jau5 daai3 sou3 hok6 wo4 zung1 man4 syu1.
Today I brought math and Chinese books.

課外書都要讀多啲，如果唔係唔可以吸收多啲知識。
fo3 ngoi6 syu1 dou1 jiu3 duk6 do1 di1, jyu4 gwo2 m4 hai6 m4 ho2 ji5 kap1 sau1 do1 di1 zi1 sik1.
We should read more extracurricular books too, or we can’t absorb more knowledge.

但係我想玩埋個遊戲先吖！
daan6 hai6 ngo5 seung2 waan2 maai4 go3 jau4 hei3 sin1 aa3!
But I want to play one more game first!

Come on。菲菲，你都係咁遲先出現。
Come on. fei1 fei1, nei5 dou1 hai6 gam3 ci4 sin1 ceot1 jin6.
Come on, Fei-Fei—you’re late again.

（打呵欠）呵……我都啱啱起身。
(daa2 ho1 him3) ho1… ngo5 dou1 ngaam1 ngaam1 hei2 san1.
(Yawning) Ah… I just woke up.

你又係冇帶書包啦？
nei5 jau6 hai6 mou5 daai3 syu1 baau1 laa1?
You forgot your schoolbag again?

唔怕，我有叮叮魔法㗎嘛。（起手）
m4 paa3, ngo5 jau5 ding1 ding1 mo4 faat3 gaa3 maa3. (hei2 sau2)
No worries—I’ve got Ding Ding Magic. (Raises hand)

比比、露露，又係你哋兩個？
bei2 bei2, lou6 lou6, jau6 hai6 nei5 dei6 loeng5 go3?
Bibi, Lulu—it’s you two again?

你撞親人呀！
nei5 zong6 can1 jan4 aa3!
You bumped into someone!

噢！係咩？我聽到有啲噪音。
o1! hai6 me1? ngo5 teng1 dou2 jau5 di1 cou3 jam1.
Oh? Really? I only hear some noise.

比比，好似係有啲普通人，見到你「比卡特羅家族」好強大的魔法，所以嘛驚親。
bei2 bei2, hou2 ci5 hai6 jau5 di1 pou2 tung1 jan4, gin3 dou2 nei5 “bei2 kaa1 dak6 lo4 gaa1 zuk6” hou2 koeng4 daai6 dik1 mo4 faat3, so2 ji5 maa3 geng1 can1.
Bibi, looks like some ordinary people saw your mighty Pikatero-family magic and got scared.

哦，原來係……講到用魔法，邊個夠我勁？嚟緊四年一度嘅「魔法大比拼」，一定係我贏，我一定會攞到「愛叮堡榮譽」。
o4, jyun4 loi4 hai6… gong2 dou3 jung6 mo4 faat3, bin1 go3 gau3 ngo5 ging6? lai4 gan2 sei3 nin4 jat1 dou6 ge3 “mo4 faat3 daai6 bei2 ping3”, jat1 ding6 hai6 ngo5 jeng4, ngo5 jat1 ding6 wui5 lo2 dou3 “oi3 ding1 bou2 wing4 jyu6”.
Oh, so that’s it… When it comes to magic, who can match me? In the upcoming once-every-four-years Magic Grand Competition, I’ll definitely win and take the Love-Ding Fort Honor.

唔使周圍講啦，一定係比比你贏。
m4 sai2 zau1 wai4 gong2 laa1, jat1 ding6 hai6 bei2 bei2 nei5 jeng4.
No need to tell everyone—you’re definitely going to win, Bibi.

等陣先吖，你頭先撞親人呀……
dang2 zan6 sin1 aa3, nei5 tau4 sin1 zong6 can1 jan4 aa3…
Hold on—you did bump into someone just now…

嘖！露露，我又聽到啲奇怪聲音。
zek1! lou6 lou6, ngo5 jau6 teng1 dou2 di1 kei4 gwaai3 seng1 jam1.
Tsk! Lulu, I’m hearing weird noises again.

比比，我知你呀，你用魔法撞到人。
bei2 bei2, ngo5 zi1 nei5 aa3, nei5 jung6 mo4 faat3 zong6 dou3 jan4.
Bibi, I know it was you—you used magic and hit people.

Baby，我哋唔可以用魔法傷害人。
Baby, ngo5 dei6 m4 ho2 ji5 jung6 mo4 faat3 soeng1 hoi6 jan4.
Baby, we can’t use magic to hurt people.

叮！
ding1!
Ding!

哼，呢啲就係魔法嘅實力。
heng1, ni1 di1 zau6 hai6 mo4 faat3 ge3 sat6 lik6.
Hmph. This is what magical power looks like.

芳花老師，比比又試用魔法撞親人啦。
fong1 faa1 lou5 si1, bei2 bei2 jau6 si3 jung6 mo4 faat3 zong6 can1 jan4 laa1.
Miss Fong-Fa, Bibi used magic to bump into people again.

我都見到㗎。
ngo5 dou1 gin3 dou2 gaa3.
I saw it too.

呀，老師好忙呀，要去校務處交表，又要去第二個課室上堂啦，呢度唔關我事，我走先啦。
aa3, lou5 si1 hou2 mong4 aa3, jiu3 heoi3 haau6 mou6 cyu3 gaau1 biu2, jau6 jiu3 heoi3 dai6 ji6 go3 fo3 sat1 soeng5 tong4 laa1, ni1 dou6 m4 gwaan1 ngo5 si6, ngo5 zau2 sin1 laa1.
Ah, teacher’s very busy—I need to submit forms at the office and teach in another classroom. This has nothing to do with me; I’m leaving first.

都話比卡特羅家族嘅魔法最犀利，老師都要畀面。
dou1 waa6 bei2 kaa1 dak6 lo4 gaa1 zuk6 ge3 mo4 faat3 zeoi3 sai1 lei6, lou5 si1 dou1 jiu3 bei2 min6.
Told you the Pikatero family’s magic is the strongest—even teachers have to show respect.

唔該借借。
m4 goi1 ze3 ze3.
Excuse me, please let me through.

喂，你個掃把好污糟，唔好行埋嚟，走開。
wai3, nei5 go3 sou3 baa2 hou2 wu1 zou1, m4 hou2 haang4 maai4 lai4, zau2 hoi1.
Hey, your broom is filthy. Don’t come near—go away.

唔好意思，我唔識用魔法，一定要用掃把。呢度有啲污糟，一定要……
m4 hou2 ji3 si3, ngo5 m4 sik1 jung6 mo4 faat3, jat1 ding6 jiu3 jung6 sou3 baa2. ni1 dou6 jau5 di1 wu1 zou1, jat1 ding6 jiu3…
Sorry, I don’t know magic, so I have to use a broom. It’s a bit dirty here, so I really need to…

Section 3 (page 5, end of Scene 1)

行開吖，你都唔係呢度學生，你梗係唔識魔法啦，去返埋位。
haang4 hoi1 aa3, nei5 dou1 m4 hai6 ni1 dou6 hok6 saang1, nei5 gang2 hai6 m4 sik1 mo4 faat3 laa1, heoi3 faan1 maai4 wai2.
Move aside. You’re not even a student here, so of course you don’t know magic—go back to your seat.

叮！
ding1!
Ding!

達爾、菲菲，你哋起身先。
daat6 ji5, fei1 fei1, nei5 dei6 hei2 san1 sin1.
Dar, Fei-Fei, you two get up first.

我唔係學生，又唔識魔法，唔使多謝我啦。
ngo5 m4 hai6 hok6 saang1, jau6 m4 sik1 mo4 faat3, m4 sai2 do1 ze6 ngo5 laa1.
I’m not a student, and I don’t know magic, so you don’t need to thank me.

你係學校校工嚟㗎喎，學校你都有份。唔該。
nei5 hai6 hok6 haau6 haau6 gung1 lai4 gaa3 wo3, hok6 haau6 nei5 dou1 jau5 fan6. m4 goi1.
You’re a school worker too—you’re part of this school as well. Thank you.

（起身後）Too bad，非常唔優雅。
(hei2 san1 hau6) Too bad, fei1 soeng4 m4 jau1 ngaa5.
(After getting up) Too bad. Very ungraceful.

比比太過份啦，遙遙，為咗愛叮堡榮譽，你一定要贏佢吖。
bei2 bei2 taai3 gwo3 fan6 laa1, jiu4 jiu4, wai6 zo2 oi3 ding1 bou2 wing4 jyu6, nei5 jat1 ding6 jiu3 jeng4 keoi5 aa3.
Bibi has gone too far. Yiu-Yiu, for Love-Ding Fort’s honor, you must beat her.

Baby，要優雅贏。
Baby, jiu3 jau1 ngaa5 jeng4.
Baby, win with elegance.

我唔會輸，唔好忘記，我背後有強大的力量。
ngo5 m4 wui5 syu1, m4 hou2 mong4 gei3, ngo5 bui3 hau6 jau5 koeng4 daai6 dik1 lik6 loeng6.
I won’t lose. Don’t forget—I’ve got great power behind me.

各位同學，唔好意思老師遲少少，你哋唔好掛住傾計，鐘上堂啦。
gok3 wai6 tung4 hok6, m4 hou2 ji3 si3 lou5 si1 ci4 siu2 siu2, nei5 dei6 m4 hou2 gwaa3 zyu6 king2 gai2, zung1 soeng6 tong4 laa1.
Students, sorry I’m a bit late. Don’t keep chatting—the bell says class starts now.

係，柔柔老師！早晨。
hai6, jau4 jau4 lou5 si1! zou2 san4.
Yes, Miss Yau-Yau! Good morning.

管家守則第二條專業守則第一節。
gun2 gaa1 sau2 zak1 dai6 ji6 tiu4 zyun1 jip6 sau2 zak1 dai6 jat1 zit3.
Butler Code, Article 2, Professional Standards, Section 1.

要有絕對專業的知識，不論烹調食物、清潔打掃、採購家品的認知，同時亦要時刻掌握最新資訊。
jiu3 jau5 zyut6 deoi3 zyun1 jip6 dik1 zi1 sik1, bat1 leon6 paang1 tiu4 sik6 mat6, cing1 git3 daa2 sou3, coi2 kau3 gaa1 ban2 dik1 jing6 zi1, tung4 si4 jik6 jiu3 si4 hak1 zoeng2 ak1 zeoi3 san1 zi1 seon3.
You must have fully professional knowledge—from cooking and cleaning to household procurement awareness—and keep up with the latest information at all times.

管家守則第六條工作紀律第四節。
gun2 gaa1 sau2 zak1 dai6 luk6 tiu4 gung1 zok3 gei2 leot6 dai6 sei3 zit3.
Butler Code, Article 6, Work Discipline, Section 4.

遵守工作時間、服裝規定、公司規則等。

Butler Code, Article 17, Safety Awareness, Section 8B.

Butler Code, Article 38, Illness Guidelines, Section 2A.

當管家患上傳染病，例如傷風、感冒、腸胃炎、水痘或者手足口病嘅時候，要即時休息，隔離自己，絕對唔可以傳染畀少爺小姐。

If a butler has a contagious illness—like a cold, flu, gastroenteritis, chickenpox, or hand-foot-mouth disease—they must rest immediately, isolate themselves, and never pass infection to the young masters or misses.

管家守則第四十六條私隱保護。
gun2 gaa1 sau2 zak1 dai6 sei3 sap6 luk6 tiu4 si1 jan2 bou2 wu6.
Butler Code, Article 46, Privacy Protection.

Strictly fulfill confidentiality duties; matters in the young masters’ and misses’ homes must never be disclosed to anyone.

各位管家果然非常專業，熟讀管家守則。最近我收到有少爺小姐投訴，話管家間唔中做錯、做漏。
gok3 wai2 gun2 gaa1 gwo2 jin4 fei1 soeng4 zyun1 jip6, suk6 duk6 gun2 gaa1 sau2 zak1. zeoi3 gan6 ngo5 sau1 dou3 jau5 siu3 je5 siu2 ze2 tau4 sou3, waa6 gun2 gaa1 gaan1 m4 zung1 zou6 co3, zou6 lau6.

作為管家，永遠要比少爺小姐早起。因為作為日理萬機嘅少爺小姐，絕對唔可以浪費寶貴時間瞓懶覺。

Section 2 (pages 13-14)

好似有人大聲叫緊？

James, alright already—let’s continue our tea.

ngo5 soeng2 zi1 nei5 tau4 sin1 dou3 dai2 teng1 dou2 hai6 me1 seng1?

Section 2 (pages 33-34)

Without us, they actually learned how to cooperate.

我第一次覺得原來混亂，都可以好可愛。

Looking at each other, we warmly receive it.

共聚早餐窩心暖笠笠。
gung6 zeoi6 zou2 caan1 wo1 sam1 nyun5 lap6 lap6.
Gathering for breakfast, warm and comforting.

共聚早餐窩心暖笠笠。

個榮譽點解會喺失物箱？
go3 wing4 jyu6 dim2 gaai2 wui5 hai2 sat1 mat6 soeng1?
How did the Honor end up in the lost-and-found box?

（向比比，小聲）你尋日練歌嗰陣，借咗做道具。
(hoeng3 bei2 bei2, siu2 seng1) nei5 cam4 jat6 lin6 go1 go2 zan6, ze3 zo2 zou6 dou6 geoi6.
(To Bibi, softly) Yesterday during rehearsal, you borrowed it as a prop.

（尷尬一笑）嗯啊……藝術需要神秘感嘛。
(gaan3 gaai3 jat1 siu3) m4 aa3… ngai6 seot6 seoi1 jiu3 san4 bei6 gam2 maa3.
(Awkward smile) Mm… art needs a sense of mystery, right?

個榮譽污糟，邊個負責擦返乾淨？
go3 wing4 jyu6 wu1 zou1, bin1 go3 fu6 zaak3 caat3 faan1 gon1 zing6?
The Honor is dirty—who will clean it up?

（舉手）交畀我負責拋光同埋上蠟，唔使三十秒，即刻閃到你都認唔到。
(geoi2 sau2) gaau1 bei2 ngo5 fu6 zaak3 paau1 gwong1 tung4 maai4 soeng6 laat6, m4 sai2 saam1 sap6 miu5, zik1 hak1 sim2 dou3 nei5 dou1 jing6 m4 dou2.
(Raises hand) Leave polishing and waxing to me—under thirty seconds, and it’ll shine so much you won’t even recognize it.

（舉手，微笑）等我嚟。
(geoi2 sau2, mei4 siu3) dang2 ngo5 lai4.
(Raises hand, smiling) Let me do it.

我都！
ngo5 dou1!
Me too!

（遞抹布）一人一塊抹布，由上到下、順一個方向，就唔會花。
(dai6 mut3 bou3) jat1 jan4 jat1 faai3 mut3 bou3, jau4 soeng6 dou3 haa6, seon6 jat1 go3 fong1 hoeng3, zau6 m4 wui5 faa1.
(Hands out cloths) One cloth per person; wipe top to bottom in one direction, and it won’t streak.

（指令）分兩組，三個擦左，三個擦右。
(zi2 ling6) fan1 loeng5 zou2, saam1 go3 caat3 zo2, saam1 go3 caat3 jau6.
(Giving orders) Split into two teams—three wipe left, three wipe right.

知道。
zi1 dou6.
Got it.

（看向管家）見到未？最強魔法唔係「叮」，而係郁手去做。
(hon3 hoeng3 gun2 gaa1) gin3 dou2 mei6? zeoi3 koeng4 mo4 faat3 m4 hai6 “ding1”, ji4 hai6 juk1 sau2 heoi3 zou6.
(Looks at the butlers) See that? The strongest magic isn’t a “ding”—it’s getting your hands moving and doing it.

而家公布結果。
ji4 gaa1 gung1 bou3 git3 gwo2.
Now we announce the result.

（舉手，小聲）當然係……
(geoi2 sau2, siu2 seng1) dong1 jin4 hai6…
(Raises hand, whispers) Of course it is…

（低聲）低調、低調！
(dai1 seng1) dai1 diu6, dai1 diu6!
(Whispering) Low-key, low-key!

今年「愛叮堡榮譽」決賽都係無人贏。
gam1 nin4 “oi3 ding1 bou2 wing4 jyu6” kyut3 coi3 dou1 hai6 mou4 jan4 jeng4.
In this year’s “Love-Ding Honor” final, there is no winner.

Section 2 (pages 37-38)

吓？即係我唔係第一？
haa2? zik1 hai6 ngo5 m4 hai6 dai6 jat1?
Huh? So I’m not first place?

（忍笑）你先整唔見個榮譽。
(jan2 siu3) nei5 sin1 zing2 m4 gin3 go3 wing4 jyu6.
(Holding back a laugh) You were the one who lost the Honor first.

（吸口氣，由硬撐變放低）好啦，我知道啦……對唔住！我決定我以後唔會叫人做。
(kap1 hau2 hei3, jau4 ngaang6 caang2 bin3 fong3 dai1) hou2 laa1, ngo5 zi1 dou6 laa1… deoi3 m4 zyu6! ngo5 kyut3 ding6 ngo5 ji5 hau6 m4 wui5 giu3 jan4 zou6.
(Takes a breath, softening) Alright, I get it… I’m sorry! I’ve decided I won’t order people around anymore.

（點頭）我都知：我唔可以成日靠「叮」，有啲嘢要識自己做。
(dim2 tau4) ngo5 dou1 zi1: ngo5 m4 ho2 ji5 sing4 jat6 kaau3 “ding1”, jau5 di1 je5 jiu3 sik1 zi6 gei2 zou6.
(Nods) I know too: I can’t rely on “ding” all the time—some things I need to do myself.

所謂「人最強的魔法」，唔係擁有一個魔法；而係學識自立、合群、同埋點樣同人相處。
so2 wai6 “jan4 zeoi3 koeng4 dik1 mo4 faat3”, m4 hai6 jung2 jau5 jat1 go3 mo4 faat3; ji4 hai6 hok6 sik1 zi6 lap6, hap6 kwan4, tung4 maai4 dim2 joeng6 tung4 jan4 soeng1 cyu5.
The so-called “strongest human magic” is not possessing one spell; it is learning independence, teamwork, and how to get along with others.

所以今年新增兩個大獎。
so2 ji5 gam1 nin4 zan1 zang1 loeng5 go3 daai6 zoeng2.
So this year, we are adding two major awards.

第一個，「成長自立大獎」，由遙遙、安娜、達爾得。
dai6 jat1 go3, “sing4 zoeng2 zi6 lap6 daai6 zoeng2”, jau4 jiu4 jiu4, on1 no4, daat6 ji5 dak1.
The first, the “Growth and Independence Award,” goes to Yiu-Yiu, Anna, and Dar.

因為佢哋唔怕失敗，敢作嘗試。
jan1 wai6 keoi5 dei6 m4 paa3 sat1 baai6, gam2 zok3 soeng4 si3.
Because they are not afraid of failure and dare to try.

而第二個獎，就係「同行勇氣大獎」，得獎者係比比。
ji4 dai6 ji6 go3 zoeng2, zau6 hai6 “tung4 hang4 jung5 hei3 daai6 zoeng2”, dak1 zoeng2 ze2 hai6 bei2 bei2.
And the second award is the “Courage to Walk Together Award,” and the winner is Bibi.

因為佢肯認錯和改。
jan1 wai6 keoi5 hang2 jing6 co3 wo4 goi2.
Because she is willing to admit mistakes and change.

（戴好後，向眾人）我唔再用「叮叮」去推開人；我想用雙手去拉近人。
(daai3 hou2 hau6, hoeng3 zung3 jan4) ngo5 m4 zoi3 jung6 “ding1 ding1” heoi3 teoi1 hoi1 jan4; ngo5 soeng2 jung6 soeng1 sau2 heoi3 laai1 gan6 jan4.
(After putting it on, to everyone) I won’t use “ding ding” to push people away anymore; I want to use my hands to pull people closer.

（小聲）我可唔可以繼續做好朋友？
(siu2 seng1) ngo5 ho2 m4 ho2 ji5 gai3 zuk6 zou6 hou2 pang4 jau5?
(Softly) Can I keep being your good friend?

仲有我！
zung6 jau5 ngo5!
And me too!

（笑）可以，不過要一齊執返好個失物箱。
(siu3) ho2 ji5, bat1 gwo3 jiu3 jat1 cai4 zap1 faan1 hou2 go3 sat1 mat6 soeng1.
(Smiles) Yes—but we all have to tidy the lost-and-found box together.

（走前一步）今日，你哋學識自己行；我哋學識退後守候。由依賴，走到自立；由命令，走到合作。
(zau2 cin4 jat1 bou6) gam1 jat6, nei5 dei6 hok6 sik1 zi6 gei2 haang4; ngo5 dei6 hok6 sik1 teoi3 hau6 sau2 hau6. jau4 ji1 laai6, zau2 dou3 zi6 lap6; jau4 ming6 ling6, zau2 dou3 hap6 zok3.
(Steps forward) Today, you learned to walk on your own; we learned to step back and stay watchful. From dependence to independence; from commands to cooperation.

一齊，用最強的魔法，由愛，加上勇氣，再加上實踐，向前行。
jat1 cai4, jung6 zeoi3 koeng4 dik1 mo4 faat3, jau4 oi3, gaa1 soeng6 jung5 hei3, zoi3 gaa1 soeng6 sat6 cin2, hoeng3 cin4 haang4.
Together, with the strongest magic—love, plus courage, plus practice—we move forward.

（眾人唱）《最強的魔法》
(zung3 jan4 coeng3) “zeoi3 koeng4 dik1 mo4 faat3”
(All sing) “The Strongest Magic”
